context: During a recent security incident, an alert was triggered when the user Luciano Herrera (pwilson@niseko.alpineskihouse.co) performed an unusual addition of credentials to the application SimulandApp. This suspect activity may indicate a potential compromise aimed at spreading phishing, data exfiltration, or unauthorized access. Following this, Luciano Herrera (CIO) initiated a suspicious directory services replication request from one machine to another.
question: While investigating further into this incident, can you identify the hostname associated with the activity where the DKM key of an ADFS object was accessed?
solution_steps: There was an unusual addition of credentials to an OAuth app by the account with SID `S-1-5-21-551436448-9871687716-9837441745-1903` (`Luciano Herrera`).
A suspected DCSync attack was performed by Luciano Herrera (CIO) from `MB-WINCLIENT` to the host `MB-DC1`.
The host `MB-DC1` read the DKM key of ADFS object id `4cac49d3-29d3-407e-8c9b-b7ebb21541b2`.
